Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fatal RTI waiting to happen, 26th June
item.description:
You have what used to be a zebra crossing that has recently been painted over. But the white zigzag Lines and a solid white stop lines indicating a junction have been recently been installed. The pedestrian crossing lights have been removed but the road bowing and dropped curb signalling a crossing point are still there. A mother, child and myself just walked into active traffic thinking it was a crossing as it was a few weeks ago. My partner saw a lady with a pram do the same this morning. At the moment it’s giving out so many mixed signals and still looks like a zebra crossing to pedestrians at first glance. Somone is going to get run over and as we get trucks and buses down this busy road. It’s hosting likely to be very serious or a fatalist. Someone come see this as the photo doesn’t do it justice as it’s very dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Brockley Rise, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked truck, 26th June
item.description:
This vehicle often parks in Chequers Way N13 6DA near the junction with Pasteur Gardens obstructing the traffic. Since early afternoon it has been parked with the rear at least a metre over the double yellow lines around that junction. It is very dangerous & needs to be moved as soon as possible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chequers Way, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There’s more tents now, 26th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Steelyard Passage, City of London

item.title: Rubbish in front of Westminster Magistrates’ Court, 26th June
item.description:
The gated area in front of Westminster Magistrates’ Court has not been clean for years. Piles of cans, bottles, and other litter is always present in the area. Absolute disgrace. Please clean it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 181, Marylebone Road, Marylebone, London

item.title: Abandoned untaxed van, 26th June
item.description:
This van has been abandoned for over two months in Oakmere Road by number 19. Its road tax expired on 23rd April 2025. 'The Local Authority can take Enforcement action on a vehicle parked on a public road if its tax has expired for more than 2 calendar months and 1 day' so we expect swift Enforcement action. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakmere Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
